entry.title: Des Moines, IA
entry.summary:
Basic stats

  • Why Des Moines, Iowa? (blog post coming soon)
  • City population: 200k, Metro population: 570k
  • Approximate distance driven on trip: 7200 miles
  • Google Maps: Des Moines

General

  • The West End of the city has more to do for young professionals than other parts of the city

Coffee Shops

  • Cafe De Scala
  • Java Joes. Oldest coffee roaster in Des Moines.
  • Zanzibars Coffee

Bars

  • Blue Moon Dueling Piano Bar

Restaurants

  • Django. I mean, holy shit. I'm a Django developer so I have to go here.
  • Graziano Bros Italian Foods. Known for their sausages. In business since 1912.
  • Centro. For their pizza and bloody marys.
  • Dos Rios

Misc

  • Cool Saturday morning farmer's market

entry.summary:
Basic stats

  • Why Seattle, Washington? (blog post coming soon)
  • City population: 620k, Metro population: 3.5m
  • Approximate distance driven on trip: 5200 miles
  • Google Maps: Seattle

Startups

  • SEOmoz. These guys are awesome.
  • Socrata. Platform that data.gov and some of CFPB's data APIs are built on.
  • SurveyMonkey. Uses Python according to this job posting.
  • Seattle Area Start ups

Coffee Shops

  • Caffee D'Arte. On 1st Avenue, recommended by a coworker as her favorite coffee shop in Seattle.

entry.title: Portland, OR
entry.summary:
Basic stats

  • Why Portland, Oregon? (blog post coming soon)
  • City population: 600k, Metro population: 2.3m
  • Approximate distance driven on trip: 5000 miles
  • Google Maps: Portland

Accomodations

  • McMenamins Kennedy School. Converted elementary school with bars. A bus ride to Downtown.

Start Ups

  • Pearl District is the business area where many start ups are located.
  • Puppet Labs. Infrastructure automation.
  • Urban Airship. Push notifications and mobile platform services.
  • Jive. Enterprise social business software.

Breakfast

  • Bumblekiss Cafe. Great bacon and cinnamon swirl bread.
  • Gravy
  • Mother's Bistro
  • Tin Shed Garden Cafe. Local food, "spiritual journey", compost leftovers. Hippie heaven, although I bet it taste damn good.

Coffee Shops

  • Urban Grind Coffeehouse and Roaster
  • Tiny's

Beer

  • Fifth Quadrant
  • Check out the street Mississippi Ave to stroll down (40-50 bars/restaurants)

Karaoke

  • Baby Ketten Karaoke

Restaurants

  • EaT Oyster Bar (breakfast is better than the food).
  • Screen Door Restaurant (best breakfast and dinner). Usually 2 hour wait to get in.
  • Beaterville Cafe. (second best place to eat) - like an old grandma's house
  • Cricket Cafe (biscuits and gravy)

References

  • Special thanks to Zack Smith for most of the Portland recommendations listed here.

Photo Attribution

  • Flickr Creative Commons License Source Link

  • City population: 800k, Metro population: 4.3m
  • Approximate distance driven on trip: 4350 miles

Start Ups

  • Github.
  • 99 Designs. I used these guys to design my Coding Across America logo (site redesign coming soon).
  • Mixpanel. Python and Vim guys.
  • Eventbrite. Uses Python for data analysis according to this post.
  • DISQUS. Quite possibly the largest site on the web running Django.
  • ZeroCater. Python / Django users according to this job posting.

Coding

entry.title: Austin, TX
entry.summary:
Basic stats

  • Why Austin, Texas? (blog post coming soon)
  • City population: 820k, Metro population: 1.7m
  • Approximate distance driven on trip: 1900 miles
  • Google Maps: Austin

Areas of Interest

  • 4th Street - bars & restaurants. More geared towards professionals living in Austin than the college students.
  • 6th Street - college craziness at night. Some cool places to hang out and grab a beer during the day.
  • Congress Avenue Bridge - the streets around the bridge have some cool shopping spots and restaurants

Start Ups

  • CopperEgg is a cloud monitoring company.
  • Daily Dot is a team of writers around the country and headquartered in Austin. Write about Internet communities instead of traditional geographic communities.
  • Contiuum Analytics. Data analysis and visualization based on Python. Definitely need to talk to these guys.
  • Web Cube. CMS built on Python.

Bars

  • Cedar Street. I fell in love with this spot back when I first visited Austin in 2008. Great outdoor live music and interesting indoor/outdoor bar set up.

Coffee Shops

  • The Hideout. I hung out here and coded during my Austin vacation in June 2012. Awesome little place.
  • Halcyon. Great coffee, lots of space to stretch out and do work (including corner spots with pillows), and bottomless mimosas for $7.
  • Jo's 2nd Street Coffee.
  • Caffe Medici.
  • Austin Java. City Hall location on 2nd Street.

Froyo

  • Berry Austin.

Conferences

  • Bazaar Voice will just miss my trip on April 11-13, but I could stick around for a few more days if it's something I want to go to.

Restaurants

  • Franklin Barbeque. Worth the wait in line.

Photo Attribution

  • Flickr Creative Commons License Source Link

entry.title: New Orleans, LA
entry.summary:
Basic Stats

  • Why New Orleans, Louisiana?
  • City population: 345k, Metro population: 1.2m
  • Approximate distance driven on trip: 1400 miles
  • Google Maps: New Orleans

Coffee Shops

  • Cafe Du Monde. A classic New Orleans staple (tourist trap?). I was here before in March 2011.

Venture Capital and Funding

  • The Louisiana Fund
  • BVM Capital. An office in New Orleans (in addition to their New York office).
  • FBT Investments
  • Biz Capital

Start Up Support

  • New Orleans Startup Fund
  • Launchpad New Orleans. Shared working space in New Orleans.

Conferences

  • Society for Information Technology and Teacher Education Conference is taking place during the time I will be in New Orleans. Submissions are due by Oct 25, 2012.

Interesting

  • Digital Media tax credit, technology development projects in Louisiana, you get up to 35% labor tax credit, non-Louisiana is 25% labor tax credit

References

  • New Orleans Wikipedia Entry

Photo Attribution

  • Flickr Creative Commons License

  • MD Venture Partners. Specific to the life sciences industry, particularly treatments and cures for musculoskeletal diseases.

entry.title: Nashville, TN
entry.summary:
Basic stats

  • Why Nashville, Tennessee?
  • City population: 625k, Metro population: 1.6m
  • Approximate distance driven on trip: 800 miles
  • Google Maps: Nashville

First Glance Start Up Scene

  • Support for tech start ups with the Grow Nashville and Entrepreneur Center initiatives.
  • Recently Nashville was named as one of the top easiest cities for starting a small business

Interesting Start Ups/Small Businesses

  • Stratasan. Healthcare data analytics. Stratasan is using Python & Django.
  • Borderjump. International payments and exports API. Borderjump is using Python & Django.
  • Source Your City. Connects reporters and bloggers with specialty matter experts from various fields. Unclear what technology platform their service is built on.

Meetups

  • Grow Nashville

Coffee Shops

  • Fido

Start Up Infrastructure

  • Startup Tennessee
  • CoLab
  • Entrepreneur Center

Universities

  • Vanderbilt University

References

  • Yelp: Coffee Shops
  • Wikipedia: Nashville, TN
  • Why There Aren't 20 Nashville Startups You Need To Know About
  • 7 Nashville Start Ups That Seem to Be Doing Everything Right
  • Built In Nashville

Photo Attribution

  • Flickr Creative Commons License

entry.title: Charlotte, NC
entry.summary:
Basic stats

  • Why Charlotte, North Carolina?
  • City population: 750k, Metro population: 1.7m
  • Approximate distance driven on trip: 385 miles
  • Google Maps: Charlotte

First Glance Start Up Scene

  • Mostly consulting firms focused on providing services to large companies in the area
  • Some product firms again focused on products for the B2B market

Interesting Start Ups/Small Businesses

  • Red Ventures
  • Adaptivity
  • SubHub. US office.
  • iFuturistics. Technology consulting firm.

Venture Capital

  • List of VCs in and near Charlotte, NC
  • Top of the List NC VCs. Article on VC firms in NC. Damn paywall.

Coffee Shops

  • Amelie's French Bakery. Two locations in Charlotte, but the one at 2424 N Davidson St. is the one to go to. Open 24/7.
  • Smelly Cat Coffeehouse
  • Cluck n Cup. Chicken pot pies and coffee. Interesting combination. Recommended by my friend Alex McClain.
  • Dilworth Coffee.
  • The Coffee Shop Economy. Relevant article.

Start Up Ecosystem

  • Hackerspace Charlotte. Thursday, March 14 there will be a meetup for "Green Hacking" - renewable energy. Also it's open build night (Contact Mark at inventor42@hotmail.com or inventor42 on the irc with any questions). Another article on Hackerspace.
  • Queen City Forward.
  • Packard Place. Meetups around entrepreneurship.
  • RevTech Labs. Start up incubator.

Relevant Articles

  • Start Me Up article in Charlotte Magazine.
  • Starting a Business Resources.

Meetups

  • Python & Django.

References

  • Official city site
  • Wikipedia: Charlotte city center
  • Bechtler Museum of Art
  • Crunchbase Search Within 35 Miles of Charlotte, NC
  • Quora - Charlotte, NC Startups?
  • The Atlantic on the South's "Silicon Valley"

Photo Attribution

  • Flickr Creative Commons License

entry.title: Charlottesville, VA
entry.summary:
Basic stats

  • Why Charlottesville?
  • City population: 43k, Charlottesville + Albemarle County: 120k
  • Approximate distance driven on trip: 115 miles
  • Google Maps: Charlottesville

First Glance Start Up Scene

  • Some small consulting firms focused on the Department of Defense clients located here: the National Ground Intelligence Center (NGIC) and a piece of the Defense Intelligence Agency (DIA)

Coffee Shops

  • Shenandoah Joe Coffee Roaster on Preston Ave. I've been here before and I love the place.
  • Mudhouse on the Downtown Mall. Again, I've been to this spot and its location on the Downtown Mall is perfect.
  • Para Coffee on The Corner (near Grounds).
  • Lataza Coffee House in Belmont.
  • Greenberry's - a chain, but I really like their location at Barrack's Road Shopping Center.
  • Top 3 Independent Coffee Shops in Charlottesville, VA. One of these places (Fox Park) is unfortunately no longer in business.

Entrepreneurship

  • Open Space is a collaboration space for individuals and small businesses that need a place to work.
  • Batten Institute for Entrepreneurship (Darden School of Business) studies innovation and entrepreneurship from an academic standpoint.
  • Charlottesville Technology Incubator.

Venture Capital

  • Court Square Ventures
  • Tall Oaks Capital
  • Harren Equity Partners

Restaurants

  • Zinc. Awesome restaurant in Midtown Charlottesville.
  • Boylen Heights. High end burger spot on The Corner.
  • Littlejohn's New York Deli. Turkey sandwich please.
  • Fellini's #9. Amazing Italian food. Classic Downtown Mall location.
  • X Lounge. Solid for going out or grabbing some food.
  • Blue Light Grill. Great food and spot right on the Downtown Mall.

References

  • Wikipedia Entry for Charlottesville, VA

Photo Attribution

  • Flickr Creative Commons License
